title: Compact operator
summary: In functional analysis, a branch of mathematics, a compact operator is a linear operator T : X â†’ Y {\displaystyle T:X\to Y} , where X , Y {\displaystyle X,Y} are normed vector spaces, with the property that T {\displaystyle T} maps bounded subsets of X {\displaystyle X} to relatively compact subsets of Y {\displaystyle Y} (subsets with compact closure in Y {\displaystyle Y} ). Such an operator is necessarily a bounded operator, and so continuous.[1] Some authors require that X , Y {\displaystyle X,Y} are Banach, but the definition can be extended to more general spaces.
